job_title: Learning and Development in Rugby, England
pros:
I enjoyed by time working in a friendly professionally, collaborative environment where I felt supported in my role. 
Generous pension scheme
Friendly staff
Modern office
cons: My reason for moving on was to further develop in my career, despite the opportunities that were on offer this is a small organisation and opportunities are sometimes limited.

job_title: Head of Finance in Rugby, England
cons: Sluggish with change, high priority is donors and marketing can feel non inclusive

Promotes change but little change internally.  Staff tend to be long serving so reluctant to change and if you challenge or go against the stagnant approach it’s not received well. Culture could be seen as bullying in some departments.   Would not recommend my previous team due to the manager in that team.  Lack of understanding of mental health and it’s impact to daily living and as a disability.

pros: mission-driven, fair and kind teams, great HR team who have peoples best interests at heart
cons: could be more efficient and less silo'd across teams - needs more integration between UK and overseas offices

pros: A lot of very passionate people
Good support to employees and nice colleagues
cons: Many organisational changes and restructurations with some redundancies

pros:
Good work life balance , generous holiday and pension.
Also working for a good cause that changes people lives all over the world
cons: Small teams mean that career advancement can be limited. Also there is a long service culture which means people are there for a long time and become stale

pros: Good work life balance, good pension, friendly place to work
cons: Long service culture which results in people becoming very stale, overpaid, and difficult to make changes

review_title: Overall good organisation with dedicated people
pros:
Everyone is very passionate about what they do. 
Flexible working
Decent pay and good benefits
cons: Limited opportunity for advancement. Currently undergoing changes but can be quite risk adverse and old fashioned.

pros: good team work and supportive supervisors
cons: delay in promotion and salary structures
